label: "Why Rent Control and Anti-Displacement Policies Matter for South Congress" by Maria Contreras

children.text: South Congress Avenue in Austin has always been one of the most unique and loved places in the city. It’s been a home for local businesses, artists, and long-time residents who’ve helped shape its creative and welcoming vibe. From vintage stores to food trucks to sidewalk performances, South Congress It’s not just a street, but it’s a whole community. Lately the community has been changing because of gentrification. South Congress is a different place. Rent is going up, small businesses are closing, and the people who made the area special are being pushed out.
